section.heading: Petition Authorized.
section.text: Any interested person may petition the Department for a declaratory ruling on the manner in which the Department would apply any of the following to a person or property on the facts set forth in the petition:

para.text: An order of the Department; or
A law that the Department enforces.
Contain the petitioner's name, address, and telephone number;
Contain a detailed statement of the facts underlying the questioned applicability of the stated regulation, order, or law; and
Pose the question of whether or in what manner the stated regulation, order, or law applies to the facts contained in the petition.

Verification. The petition shall also contain a statement by the petitioner, under oath, that the facts set forth in the petition are true to the best of the petitioner's knowledge, information, and belief.
Notice of Receipt. On receipt of a petition, the Secretary shall promptly mail the petitioner a notice of filing, indicating the date the petition was received.
Consideration and Disposition. Within 60 days after the petition is submitted, the Secretary shall:
Issue a written declaratory ruling as requested; or
Notify the petitioner in writing of the reasons for not issuing a declaratory ruling.

section.heading: Effect of Ruling.
section.text: If the Secretary issues a declaratory ruling, that ruling binds the Department and the petitioner on the facts set forth in the petition.

section.heading: Judicial Review.
section.text: A declaratory ruling issued under this chapter is subject to judicial review in the same manner that State Government Article, Title 10, Subtitle 2, Annotated Code of Maryland, provides for review of a contested case.

annotations.annotation: Human Services Article, §9-204; State Government Article, §§10-304 and 10-305; Annotated Code of Maryland
